sentence.Network_en: The King had brought his own bodyguard of twenty armed men.
sentence.Network_cn: 国王带了20名持枪的贴身侍卫。

sentence.Network_en: The President arrived, followed by his personal bodyguard.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统来了，随行的是他的私人保镖。

sentence.Network_en: "The Bodyguard" is a fairly bog-standard thriller.
sentence.Network_cn: 《保镖》是一部毫无新意的惊险电影。

entry.def: A bodyguard is a person or a group of people employed to protect someone.

example.ex: Three of his bodyguards were injured in the attack...
example.tran: 在这次袭击事件中，他有3名保镖受了伤。

example.ex: The King had brought his own bodyguard of twenty armed men.
example.tran: 国王带了20名持枪的贴身侍卫。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who escorts and protects a prominent person
2. a group of men who escort and protect some important person

sentences.en: He keeps a bodyguard of ten men.
She has to have an armed bodyguard wherever she goes.
sentences.cn: 她不管到哪儿都得有带武器的保镖跟从。

sentences.en: The Queen’s bodyguard is〔are〕 standing at the entrance.
sentences.cn: 女王的卫队站立在入口处。
